Job Title: Lighting & Audio Technician

Location: Greater Richmond Region, VA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Public Relations, Writing/Editing

Description:
Join our Team as a Lighting & Audio Technician
We’re looking for technicians eager to embark on a rewarding career in lighting and audio technology. The right candidate will start out on our outdoor lighting installation team working on residential and commercial projects. 
Why work for INARAY?
INARAY is an award winning lighting and home technology company based in Richmond, VA. We offer innovative products in outdoor and interior lighting, comprehensive home automation, automated shading solutions, and superior indoor and outdoor sound systems. At INARAY we prioritize innovation, creativity, and teamwork. As a Lighting Technician, you'll have the opportunity to work on a variety of projects and collaborate with a team that delivers exceptional results. We offer competitive compensation, ongoing training, professional development, and a supportive work environment.
Key Responsibilities:Install, repair and maintain low voltage lighting systems and outdoor audioExpertly install transformers to power our innovative lighting solutionsAmp and voltage reading and managementPerform trenching activities to facilitate proper placement of lighting fixturesRead CAD drawings and follow design plans to ensure precise implementation of lighting installationsUtilize project management software to efficiently coordinate tasks and track progressRecord accurate time logs and document work accomplished for project transparency and accountabilityCommunicate and collaborate with customers, crew, crew leaders and design consultant Demonstrate strong problem-solving skills to troubleshoot and resolve any technical issues that may ariseWarehouse and yard maintenance. Vehicle and equipment inspection and maintenance


We don’t have a minimum number of years experience for this role. Your talent and interest are very important to us, however here are some requirements we will be looking out for:
Basic mechanical capability and technical skills which include the ability to use hand tools, power tools and small engine equipmentA level of experience with landscape lighting, construction or electrical work. High school graduate with ability to read and speak EnglishA valid driver’s license and good driving recordAbility to carry out strenuous tasks in a fast paced environment. This will include working in uncomfortable spaces (attics, crawl spaces, outside wire/conduit burial) and climbing ladders up to 40’Good communication and time management skillsKeen eye for precision and qualitySelf motivation and strong organizational skills, demonstrating ability to work independently A positive attitude, an interest in technology, and a drive to learn

This is a 40 hour position. Pay starting at $18 per hour, commensurate with experience. Shifts are Monday-Friday 7:30am - 4pm. Some overtime may be required. 
Benefits Include:
Employee discountHealth insuranceHealth savings accountPaid time offParental leaveVision insurance

Experience Level (if available): None
